short_description: Discover Cape Verde, an archipelago of ten volcanic islands off the coast of West Africa. Experience pristine beaches, vibrant music culture, stunning volcanic landscapes, and the unique blend of African and Portuguese influences in this island paradise.

health.tap_water_safety: Generally safe in major cities, bottled water recommended
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores

tipping.hotels: Tipping is appreciated for porters and housekeeping
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though not always expected
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Cape Verde has a tropical climate with warm temperatures year-round. The islands experience a dry season from November to July and a wet season from August to October, with consistent trade winds providing pleasant conditions.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Perfect weather with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and warm temperatures. This is the peak tourist season, ideal for beach activities, water sports, hiking, and island hopping. Best time for outdoor adventures

when_to_visit.title: Shoulder Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm temperatures with occasional brief showers during the wet season. Fewer crowds and lower prices make this a great time to visit. Still excellent weather for beach activities and water sports

when_to_visit.title: Water Sports
when_to_visit.short_description: Cape Verde is a year-round destination for water sports enthusiasts. Consistent trade winds make it perfect for windsurfing, kitesurfing, and sailing. The weather is consistently warm and pleasant

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Cape Verde is during the dry season from November to July when the weather is perfect with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and ideal conditions for beach activities, water sports, hiking, and island hopping
